metadata.Title: CVE-2022-29901 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Intel microprocessor generations 6 to 8 are affected by a new Spectrevariant that is able to bypass their retpoline mitigation in the kernel toleak arbitrary data. An attacker with unprivileged user access can hijackreturn instructions to achieve arbitrary speculative code execution undercertain microarchitecture-dependent conditions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-29901` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-5.15.0-46-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-generic - 5.15.0-46.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-46-generic-64k - 5.15.0-46.49
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1016-kvm - 5.15.0-1016.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-46.49').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1016.19').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1017.21').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1017.20').

linux-gkeop package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1002.4').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1012.14').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1013.17').

linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1016.20').
linux-oem-5.17: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1013.15').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1004.4').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1').
linux-lowlatency-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1017.18~22.04.1').
